title: Ability Check Examples
excerpt: Examples of what each ability check is used for.

title: Ability Checks
excerpt: A D20 Test representing a creature's effort to overcome a challenge. See the main D20 Tests entry for full details.

title: Ability Modifier
excerpt: Saving throws are named for the ability modifiers they use.

title: Ability Modifier
excerpt: Which ability modifier to use for different types of attack rolls.

title: Ability Modifier
excerpt: An ability check is named for the ability modifier it uses.

title: Acid
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Action
excerpt: The main thing you can do on your turn in combat. You can take one action per turn, choosing from options like Attack, Cast a Spell, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Ready, Search, or Use an Object.

title: Actions
excerpt: The main actions a character can take on their turn, such as Attack, Dash, Disengage, and more.

title: Advantage
excerpt: When you have advantage on a d20 roll, you roll two d20s and use the higher result. Advantage and disadvantage cancel each other out.

title: Advantage and Disadvantage
excerpt: A rule that modifies a D20 Test by rolling two dice instead of one. See the main D20 Tests entry for full details.

title: Adventuring Equipment
excerpt: How equipment can help adventurers explore.

title: Adventuring Gear
excerpt: A list of useful items for adventurers.

title: Airborne and Waterborne Vehicles
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Alchemist's Fire
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Alchemist's Supplies
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Alchemy Crafting
excerpt: Proficiency with Alchemist's Supplies allows you to produce useful concoctions, such as potions and oils, often cheaper than buying them.

title: Ammunition
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Ammunition (Varies)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Antitoxin
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Arcane Focus
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Aristocratic (10 GP per Day)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Armor
excerpt: Details on armor categories, AC, and other properties.

title: Armor Class
excerpt: Represents how well a creature avoids being wounded.

title: Armor Training
excerpt: Rules on wearing armor with and without training.

title: Artisan's Tools
excerpt: Details on tools focused on crafting and trades.

title: Attack Action
excerpt: The most common action taken in combat. When you take the Attack action, you make one or more melee or ranged attacks.

title: Attack Roll Abilities
excerpt: Table showing which ability modifier to use.

title: Attack Rolls
excerpt: A D20 Test that determines whether an attack hits a target. See the main D20 Tests entry for full details.

title: Attune during a Short Rest
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Attunement
excerpt: Rules for forming a bond with a magic item.

title: Barding
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Blinded
excerpt: A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails ability checks requiring sight. Attack rolls against the creature have Advantage, and its attack rolls have Disadvantage.

title: Bonus Action
excerpt: A special additional action you can take on your turn. You can take a bonus action only when a special ability, spell, or feature states that you can do something as a bonus action.

title: Bonus Actions
excerpt: An additional action on your turn, which can only be taken when a special ability, spell, or other feature says you can.

title: Breaking Objects
excerpt: Rules for damaging and destroying objects.

title: Brewer's Supplies
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Brewing Potions of Healing
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Bright Light
excerpt: Bright Light lets most creatures see normally. Even gloomy days provide Bright Light, as do torches, lanterns, fires, and other sources of illumination within a specific radius.

title: Calligrapher's Supplies
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Cantrips
excerpt: A spell that can be cast at will, without using a spell slot and without being prepared in advance. Cantrips are simple but reliable magical effects.

title: Carpenter's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Carrying Objects
excerpt: Rules for carrying capacity.

title: Cartographer's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Changes to Your Speeds
excerpt: If an effect increases or decreases your Speed for a time, any special speed you have (Climb, Fly, etc.) increases or decreases by an equal amount for the same duration.

title: Charisma
excerpt: Measures force of personality, persuasiveness, and leadership ability. Charisma is important for bards, paladins, sorcerers, and warlocks.

title: Charmed
excerpt: A charmed creature can't attack the charmer, and the charmer has Advantage on social ability checks against the creature.

title: Cleave
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Climbing
excerpt: While climbing, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot. A successful DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check may be required for difficult surfaces.

title: Cobbler's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Coin Values
excerpt: Table of coin denominations and their value relative to the Gold Piece.

title: Coins
excerpt: Rules on currency denominations and selling equipment.

title: Comfortable (2 GP per Day)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Concentration
excerpt: Some spells require you to maintain concentration to keep their magic active. If you lose concentration, such a spell ends immediately.

title: Conditions (Overview)
excerpt: Many effects impose a condition, a temporary state that alters the recipient's capabilities. The specific conditions, their durations, and stacking rules are detailed in sub-entries.

title: Conditions Don't Stack
excerpt: If multiple effects impose the same condition, the effects don't get worse. The Exhaustion condition is an exception.

title: Constitution
excerpt: Measures health, stamina, and vital force. Constitution determines your hit points and affects concentration on spells.

title: Cook's Utensils
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Crafting Equipment
excerpt: Rules for making nonmagical items, potions, and scrolls.

title: Crafting Nonmagical Items
excerpt: Rules for crafting nonmagical items, requiring tools, raw materials, and time.

title: Crawling
excerpt: While crawling, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot. Crawling is often associated with the Prone condition.

title: Crew
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: D20 Tests
excerpt: The core mechanic for determining the outcome of an uncertain action, encompassing ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls.

title: Damage Threshold
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Darkness
excerpt: Darkness creates a Heavily Obscured area. Characters face Darkness outdoors at night, within unlit dungeons, or in areas of magical Darkness.

title: Deafened
excerpt: A deafened creature can't hear and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.

title: Dexterity
excerpt: Measures agility, reflexes, and balance. Dexterity is important for ranged combat, initiative, armor class, and avoiding area effects.

title: Difficulty Class
excerpt: How the DC for a saving throw is determined.

title: Difficulty Class
excerpt: Represents the task's difficulty for an ability check.

title: Dim Light
excerpt: Dim Light, also called shadows, creates a Lightly Obscured area. The soft light of twilight and dawn also counts as Dim Light.

title: Disadvantage
excerpt: When you have disadvantage on a d20 roll, you roll two d20s and use the lower result. Advantage and disadvantage cancel each other out.

title: Disguise Kit
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Duration
excerpt: A condition lasts either for a duration specified by the effect that imposed it or until it is countered.

title: Ending Attunement
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Equipment
excerpt: Rules and prices for weapons, armor, and other kinds of equipment.

title: Equipment Proficiencies
excerpt: Details proficiency with weapons and tools, allowing a character to add their Proficiency Bonus to relevant checks.

title: Exhaustion
excerpt: Exhaustion is a cumulative condition with multiple levels. Each level imposes penalties to D20 tests and speed.

title: Expertise
excerpt: A feature that doubles your proficiency bonus for chosen skills or tools, representing exceptional mastery in those areas.

title: Exploration
excerpt: Rules for delving into dangerous and mysterious places.

title: Finding Hidden Objects
excerpt: Rules for searching for hidden objects.

title: Finesse
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Flying
excerpt: A variety of effects allow a creature to fly. While flying, you fall if you have the Incapacitated or Prone condition or your Fly Speed is reduced to 0.

title: Food, Drink, and Lodging
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Forgery Kit
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Frightened
excerpt: A frightened creature has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight, and it can't willingly move closer to the source.

title: Gaming Set (Varies)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Glassblower's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Grappled
excerpt: A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it has Disadvantage on attack rolls against any target other than the grappler.

title: Graze
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Hazards
excerpt: Rules for environmental dangers like fire and falling.

title: Heavy
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Herbalism & Gathering
excerpt: Proficiency with an Herbalism Kit allows you to identify plants, safely collect them, and create healing salves and potions.

title: Herbalism Kit
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Hiding
excerpt: Rules for hiding from enemies.

title: Hirelings
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Hit Points
excerpt: A measure of your character's health and stamina. When your hit points drop to 0, you fall unconscious and begin making death saving throws.

title: Identifying a Magic Item
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Incapacitated
excerpt: An incapacitated creature can't take any action, Bonus Action, or Reaction, can't speak, and their Concentration is broken.

title: Initiative
excerpt: Determines the order of turns in combat. At the start of combat, everyone rolls initiative by making a Dexterity check.

title: Interacting with Objects
excerpt: Rules for how characters interact with objects in the environment.

title: Interactions with Rerolls
excerpt: How reroll abilities interact with advantage and disadvantage.

title: Invisible
excerpt: An invisible creature can't be seen without magic or special senses. Attack rolls against it have Disadvantage, and its attack rolls have Advantage.

title: Jeweler's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Jumping
excerpt: When you jump, you make either a Long Jump (horizontal) or a High Jump (vertical), both of which are based on your Strength score.

title: Large Vehicles
excerpt: Statistics and rules for various types of large vehicles.

title: Leatherworker's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Lifestyle Expenses
excerpt: Summarizes the cost of living, from Wretched to Aristocratic.

title: Light
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Light Rules
excerpt: Rules for Bright Light, Dim Light, and Darkness.

title: Light, Medium, or Heavy Armor
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Loading
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Lockpicking
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Long Rest
excerpt: A period of extended downtime lasting at least 8 hours, during which a character sleeps or performs light activity. A long rest restores all lost hit points and spent resources.

title: Magic Action (Cast a Spell)
excerpt: Using your action to cast a spell. Most spells have a casting time of 1 action, making this one of the most common actions for spellcasters.

title: Magic Items
excerpt: General rules for using magic items.

title: Mason's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Mastery Properties
excerpt: Definitions for weapon mastery properties.

title: Modest (1 GP per Day)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Mounts and Cargo
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Mounts and Other Animals
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Mounts and Vehicles
excerpt: Rules for mounts, vehicles, and related gear.

title: Multiple Items of the Same Kind
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Musical Instrument (Varies)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Navigator's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Nick
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: No More Than Three Items
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Obscured Areas
excerpt: Rules for Lightly and Heavily Obscured areas.

title: One at a Time
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: One Thing at a Time
excerpt: The game uses actions to govern how much you can do at one time. You can take only one action at a time. This principle is most important in combat.

title: Opportunity Attack
excerpt: A special reaction you can take when a hostile creature you can see moves out of your reach. The most common type of reaction.

title: Other Tools
excerpt: Tools that support adventure and other pursuits.

title: Painter's Supplies
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Paired Items
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Paralyzed
excerpt: A paralyzed creature is Incapacitated, can't move or speak, and automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. Attacks against it have Advantage and are critical hits if the attacker is within 5 feet.

title: Passengers
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Petrified
excerpt: A petrified creature is transformed into a solid inanimate substance. It is Incapacitated, can't move or speak, has resistance to all damage, and automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

title: Poison Crafting
excerpt: Proficiency with a Poisoner's Kit allows you to create poisons from various materials and handle them safely.

title: Poisoned
excerpt: A poisoned creature has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

title: Poisoner's Kit
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Poor (2 SP per Day)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Potter's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Proficiency
excerpt: Represents a character's training and aptitude, allowing them to add their proficiency bonus to certain D20 tests. See sub-entries for details on skills, saves, and equipment.

title: Proficiency Bonus
excerpt: How to add your Proficiency Bonus to a saving throw.

title: Proficiency Bonus
excerpt: A bonus added to D20 tests for which a character is proficient. It increases as a character gains levels or for monsters based on Challenge Rating.

title: Proficiency Bonus
excerpt: How to add your Proficiency Bonus to an attack roll.

title: Proficiency Bonus
excerpt: How to add your Proficiency Bonus to an ability check.

title: Prone
excerpt: A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl or stand up. It has Disadvantage on attack rolls, and attacks against it have Advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet, otherwise they have Disadvantage.

title: Properties
excerpt: Definitions for standard weapon properties.

title: Push
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Range
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Raw Materials
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Reach
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Reaction
excerpt: An instant response to a trigger of some kind, which can occur on your turn or on someone else's. The most common reaction is an opportunity attack.

title: Reactions
excerpt: An instant response to a trigger of some kind, which can occur on your turn or on someone else's.

title: Restrained
excerpt: A restrained creature's speed becomes 0. Attack rolls against it have Advantage, its attack rolls have Disadvantage, and it has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

title: Ritual Casting
excerpt: Certain spells can be cast as rituals, taking 10 additional minutes but not consuming a spell slot. Only some classes can cast rituals.

title: Roll Two D20s
excerpt: How to roll with Advantage or Disadvantage.

title: Rolling 20 or 1
excerpt: The special rules for rolling a natural 20 or natural 1 on an attack roll.

title: Saddles
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Sap
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Saving Throw Examples
excerpt: Examples of what each saving throw is used for.

title: Saving Throw Proficiencies
excerpt: Explains how proficiency applies to saving throws, allowing a character to add their Proficiency Bonus to certain saves based on their class.

title: Saving Throws
excerpt: A D20 Test representing an attempt to evade or resist a threat. See the main D20 Tests entry for full details.

title: Services
excerpt: Outlines services and other expenses that adventurers might spend money on.

title: Shield
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Ship Repair
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Short Rest
excerpt: A period of downtime lasting at least 1 hour, during which a character does nothing more strenuous than eating, drinking, reading, and tending to wounds.

title: Size Categories
excerpt: A creature or an object belongs to a size category: Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Huge, or Gargantuan. Size determines space occupied in combat.

title: Skill Proficiencies
excerpt: Represents training in a skill, allowing a character to add their Proficiency Bonus to ability checks involving that skill.

title: Slow
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Smith's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Special Senses
excerpt: Definitions for Blindsight, Darkvision, etc.

title: Special Speeds
excerpt: Rules for creatures that have multiple speeds, such as a walking speed and a flying speed, and how to switch between them during a move.

title: Speed
excerpt: The distance in feet a creature can cover when it moves on its turn. Special movement types like climbing and swimming have specific rules.

title: Speed
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Spell Slots
excerpt: A limited resource that represents the magical energy you can expend to cast spells. Spell slots are expended when you cast a spell and are regained when you finish a long rest.

title: Spellcasting
excerpt: Rules for hiring spellcasters.

title: Spellcasting Services
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Spells (Chapter Overview)
excerpt: A general introduction to how spells function in the game, covering fundamental concepts. Detailed rules are found in sub-entries under 'Spellcasting Mechanics'.

title: Squalid (1 SP per Day)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Strength
excerpt: Measures physical power, athletic training, and the extent to which you can exert raw physical force. Strength is important for melee combat and lifting, pushing, or breaking things.

title: Stunned
excerpt: A stunned creature is Incapacitated, automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls against it have Advantage.

title: Swimming
excerpt: While swimming, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot. A successful DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check may be required for rough water.

title: Tack, Harness, and Drawn Vehicles
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Temporary Hit Points
excerpt: A buffer of extra hit points that absorb damage before your actual hit points. Temporary hit points don't stack and aren't restored by healing.

title: They Don't Stack
excerpt: Rules for when multiple circumstances grant advantage or disadvantage.

title: Thieves' Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Thrown
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Time
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Time-Limited Object Interactions
excerpt: Rules for interacting with objects in combat.

title: Tinker's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Tool Proficiency
excerpt: Rule for adding your Proficiency Bonus to checks using tools.

title: Tools
excerpt: Rules for using tools for ability checks and crafting.

title: Topple
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Traps
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Travel
excerpt: Rules for traveling long distances.

title: Travel
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Travel Pace
excerpt: Rules for Fast, Normal, and Slow travel paces.

title: Two-Handed
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Unarmed Strike
excerpt: A melee attack made with a punch, kick, head-butt, or similar forceful blow. Instead of using a weapon, you use your fist, foot, or another body part.

title: Unconscious
excerpt: An unconscious creature is Incapacitated, Prone, and unaware of its surroundings. It drops what it's holding and automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. Attacks against it have Advantage and are critical hits if the attacker is within 5 feet.

title: Vehicles
excerpt: Rules for traveling in vehicles.

title: Versatile
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Vex
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Vision and Light
excerpt: Rules governing sight and obscured areas.

title: Wealthy (4 GP per Day)
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Weapon Proficiency
excerpt: Rule for adding your Proficiency Bonus to attack rolls with proficient weapons.

title: Weapons
excerpt: Details on weapon categories, damage, properties, and mastery.

title: Wearing and Wielding Items
excerpt: Rules for how magic items are worn and used.

title: Weaver's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: What is an Object?
excerpt: Defining an object in game terms.

title: Wisdom
excerpt: Measures awareness, intuition, and insight. Wisdom is important for clerics, druids, and rangers, and affects perception and many saving throws.

title: Woodcarver's Tools
excerpt: No excerpt available.

title: Wretched (Free)
excerpt: No excerpt available.
